metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16884 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NFS41+ subsystem. NFS41+ sharesmounted in different network namespaces at the same time can makebc_svc_process() use wrong back-channel IDs and cause a use-after-freevulnerability. Thus a malicious container user can cause a host kernelmemory corruption and a system panic. Due to the nature of the flaw,privilege escalation cannot be fully ruled out.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-50-generic - 4.15.0-50.54
linux-image-4.15.0-50-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-50.54
linux-image-4.15.0-50-lowlatency - 4.15.0-50.54
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-50-generic - 4.15.0-50.54
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-50-lowlatency - 4.15.0-50.54
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1036-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1036.38
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1053-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1053.57
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1039-aws - 4.15.0-1039.41
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-20-lowlatency - 4.18.0-20.21~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-20-snapdragon - 4.18.0-20.21~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-20-generic - 4.18.0-20.21~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-20-lowlatency - 4.18.0-20.21~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1032-gke - 4.15.0-1032.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1011-gke - 5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-1018-azure - 4.18.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1032-gcp - 4.15.0-1032.34

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-50.54').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1036.38').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1053.57').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1039.41').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-20.21~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1032.34').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-1018.18~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1032.34').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1034.34').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1038.43').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.15').
